availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nashville, Tennessee, notary. Tennessee native. Married Leodocia J Raworth. Father of Mary L. Raworth Yeatman and Egbert Raworth. Notary Public in Nashville in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Nashville in 1850. Commissioner of Deeds for Kentucky in Nashville in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Davidson County, Nashville, p. 158 B; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Davidson County, Nashville; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Davidson County, 13th District, p. 154; KYR-0001-017-0046.
